reviews.review: 这么经典的游戏必定会有个悲伤的结局，我很感动能有一部这么用心的作品存在，还有，G胖赶紧出3吧，Please!!

A game is only as good as it's story, and since that's incomplete it's bad for me. 

I won't comment on the graphics or the mechanics as they're dated, it was still fun to play regardless. 

That feeling of incompleteness this game leaves you on is too great, the gameplay it has cannot compensate for it.

Fun game... too bad there is no possible way the next game (if there ever is one) will satisfy fans after Valve's abandonment of one of gaming's greatest IPs.

HL2: Episode Two is a master class in game design. Brilliant pacing from start to finish, lovable characters, exemplary puzzel design and a story that has the perfect amount of thrilling highs and depressing lows. Truely, one of the greatest single player experiences you can get on PC. The only downside to this product is the ending concluding on a cliff hanger that has yet to be addressed in nearly 10 years. Still, it's absolutely worth playing if you've gone through HL2 and HL2: Episode One.

Also there's a gnome in it 10/10

Getting 100% on this game was grueling. The game requires you step outside the main path for most achievements.

Gnome and Get some Grub achievements were two of the most difficult ones.
Get some Grub is sometimes bugged, It doesn't count some that are shot/exploded. For an achievements this frustrating this can't happen.

Overall I recommend this game, play it for the story that will never be finished.

me dejaron con ganas de mas en serio, caundo saldra el ultimo episodeo o la continuacion de la historia.  el juego esta genial, lo recomiendo, es un juego que nadie se debe perder de jugar.

This was a great episode. Much better than Episode 1. Episode 1 literally has no reason to even exist. Nothing happens. You wake up, go into a place to stop "something" and then it happens anyway. Rendering everything you did utterly pointless.

This Episode has variety in gameplay and a half decent story arch. Much more enjoyable.

They could probably have condensed the first Episode into a couple of missions and combined it with this one. That would have made a lot more sense.

Unfortunately Episode 2 ends on a kind of cliff hanger and Episode 3 is clearly never going to happen since Valve are too busy failing to make eSports a real sport.

The buggy is a really fun addition to this Episode though I did feel the controls for it were a bit clunky and the mission seemed to overstay its welcome just a little bit.

Overall though this Episode is cheap as hell now and if you haven't played it already wait for a sale and it will be about £1. Can't argue with that.

Though as I said in my review for Episode 1, I'm totally sick of linear first person shooters these days. I've been there done that. This gameplay is fine but it is feeling a bit dated now. Standing there staring at a wheel go round serves as nothing but a time waster.

The year of 2007 was my introduction to PC gaming and I was blown away when I saw my cousin playing this on his laptop. The graphics were unlike anything I'd ever seen. My favorite Half Life ever.

It's more scenic that Episode One, more variety in the challenges on offer and despite the occasional feeling that they're really pushing the subplots to the limit (I'm British, BTW - we like our series short and to the point, not 20 parts and then cancellation), this is still a fitting (if frustratingly open-ended) way to see out the HL2 era.
come on volvo, just release the three!

Shooting grubbs, larvae, acid-spitting spiders was fun. The challenges and cave graphics are great, give a claustrophic feel that adds to the suspense. But..... jeez.. the  grizzley mutant body parts are, these days,  just icky -- too much horror in the world today - Syria et al, that it's no fun to play with those visuals when we're seeing them on TV. Dude..  

Played for six hours of three days. Then lost everything when overwrote my last game accidentally --- no automatic saves ??!!  Anyway, not worth six more hours to get back to where I was ....
Moving on to something less juvenile....and better programmed.

[h1] [b] Half-Life 2 [/b]  - вечно живая классика [/h1]
Прошло уже 9 лет со дня выхода  Episode Two. Много по-настоящему хороших игр выпускалось за это время.
Спустя годы, я вновь решил поиграть в E2. О даа. Ностальгия захватила полностью. Старый добрый геймплей, знакомые персонажи и сеттинг. Half-Life нельзя не любить. Несмотря на устаревший физический и графический движок, она все еще радует. Атмосфера.. Звуковое сопровождение так точно попадающее в нее и многократно усиливающее.  За это мы и любим игру. Эти тайны, загадки сюжета. Кто же такой [i] G-man [/i] ? Что за оружие находится на корабле "Борей"? Эх. Так хочется узнать ответы. 
Жаль, что разработчики совсем забросили эту серию игр. Очень жаль. Надеюсь, когда-нибудь, они одумаются и выпустят продолжение, которое не подведет и будет радовать фанатов многие многие годы.

Продолжение великолепной саги о молчаливом Гордоне Фримене и его спутницы Аликс! 
Впревые я играл игру в 2008 году, которая дала мне повествование о сюжете. 
Графика и геймплей ничем не отличается от предыдущих двух игр (не говорю о первой части. О ней в своём обзоре), но здесь проработан ИИ для npc. 
Поэтому ставляю ей 9.8/10

Una conclusión genial a la etapa Source de esta saga. No añade mucho, pero mantiene ese nivel de detalle que logra que el juego no envejezca nada.

Acá les dejo el enlace de mi video-análisis completo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EeoGrFX_zhA
